attr_labels.note: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.
attr_labels.primarySource: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.
attr_labels.education: Educational material presented to the patient (or guardian) at the time of vaccine administration.
attr_labels.doseQuantity: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.
attr_labels.reaction.date: Date of reaction to the immunization.
attr_labels.protocolApplied.authority: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP) that is being followed.
attr_labels.reasonReference: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.
attr_labels.protocolApplied.series: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.
attr_labels.programEligibility: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.
attr_labels.performer.function: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).
attr_labels.statusReason: Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.
attr_labels.isSubpotent: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.
attr_labels.protocolApplied.targetDisease: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being administered against.
attr_labels.patient: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.
attr_labels.performer.actor: The practitioner or organization who performed the action.
attr_labels.education.presentationDate: Date the educational material was given to the patient.
attr_labels.reasonCode: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.
attr_labels.vaccineCode: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.
attr_labels.education.publicationDate: Date the educational material was published.
attr_labels.identifier: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.
attr_labels.performer: Indicates who performed the immunization event.
attr_labels.reaction: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.
attr_labels.education.documentType: Identifier of the material presented to the patient.
attr_labels.subpotentReason: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.
attr_labels.encounter: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.
attr_labels.lotNumber: Lot number of the  vaccine product.
attr_labels.recorded: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.
attr_labels.site: Body site where vaccine was administered.
attr_labels.route: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.
attr_labels.protocolApplied: The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.
attr_labels.reportOrigin: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.
attr_labels.location: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.
attr_labels.education.reference: Reference pointer to the educational material given to the patient if the information was on line.
attr_labels.fundingSource: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).
attr_labels.status: Indicates the current status of the immunization event.
